website_summaries.verdict: A choice for budget-friendly fun if you want a hot tub without spending a lot of money or dealing with a major project.
pros: Inflates easily with included spa pump
Durable design shouldn't encounter many problems
Sides feel stable while seating is comfortable
Provides many features of standard hot tubs at a fraction of the price
cons: Some experienced issues with the obtaining desired temperature
May not be spacious enough for 4 people

customer_reviews.title: Just what the Doctor ordered...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect choice for the wife and I. Easy set up. Perfect temp (102-104 degrees). Bubbles are powerful. Cover was a bonus. Wasn't sure about these portable spas, but didn't have the time or money to invest in upgraded electrical and a standard tub. I am so glad I got this one. It's quiet, deep enough, big enough, hot enough, and I can't get enough! Aches and pains handled. Totally recommend to those on the fence.
customer_reviews.author: D Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love it. Very easy to put together. It gets very hot, and provides a great spa experience for such a great value. I agonized over which model and brand to get, and I'm happy with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: MES

customer_reviews.title: Husband shocked!
customer_reviews.text: Suffering back problems for years this, along with his physical therapy has given him relief. He was shocked the powers of this small, portable hot tub. Fits us both comfortably. 6'4" and 5'4". Set up was fast and easy. Water was up to temp the following day.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P Robinson

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: I love this hot tub. It works well. It does take about a day to heat up after first filling it but after that is easy to set to heat up for wjen you want to use it. I also bought a 6 person dome tent and put the tub inside it so I have a roof and privacy
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Leaky spas are no fun!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this spa in June 2016 and it worked great. This summer we filled it up and it has been leaking from the bottom ever since. For $400, this has been a complete waste of money, water and electricity. So not happy!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Price gouging
customer_reviews.text: You are price gouging. My friend wants to purchase I paid 329$ for this less than a year ago! Bad bad bad
customer_reviews.author: Chris Costa

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable powerful massage!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend's birthday. He has a bad back and knee. I was exceptionally surprised at the power the spa has!!! You could feel the bubbles massaging your back and it felt wonderful !!! I recommend putting up the temperature all the way to 104 dgrees, which takes at least 24 hours. Easy and fast set up. Spa is very sturdy yet soft in the bottom to sit in. I am pleasantly happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I can Not say enough good things about this hot tub! We absolutely love it! We built a small deck around ours & have used it almost daily since July when we bought it. It’s very easy to take care of, super easy to set up. My husband did have to run a separate plug for it, but i assume If you don’t have much running on one breaker, you’ll be just fine! Best $400 I’ve spent!
customer_reviews.author: shael dehors

customer_reviews.title: Yessss
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I just created my own vacation spot. It set up in 30 minutes but it will take about 24 hour to heat but I love it love it love it.
customer_reviews.author: CHAZZWINS

customer_reviews.title: i love it have had it for over 1 year and ...
customer_reviews.text: i love it have had it for over 1 year and use it at least twice a week. Has been very easy to drain and refill. Yes it is an inflatable but i have only had to refill the air twice in one year. the maintenance is easy and the filters and chlorine are cheap. I feel like this is a great bargain for someone who wants a hot tub but doesn't want to spend $4k and $60 a month for electric.
customer_reviews.author: william cerny

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 9 months, nice while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: It lasted 9 months. Now I get error 02. Called service and they walked me through troubleshooting, but nothing worked. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: ihventura

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. it is a poor mans spa. I thought it was well built. if it only last a year it would still have been a good buy. it is great for garage, patio or any where there is a strong electric outlet and a drain. I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Well folks, I hate to say it, but you pay for what you get. I was so stoked on this hot tub when I got it, and joked that even if it only lasted 3 months it would be worth it for what I paid. 2 months and 1 week after buying it and it had crapped out. Deflates and motor shuts off right after you turn the heat on. I knew it was cheap but am pretty amazed at just how poor it really is. Amazon customer service was top notch but this thing is a real piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: PATRICK HAGAN

customer_reviews.title: LEAKED AFTER 3 WEEKS DM said "You don't need to to anything further" HORRIBLE Customer service by DM
customer_reviews.text: After the 3rd week the spa was leaking air... I tried diligently to find the air leak no luck... contacted DM...they said they would deal with the issue....repeated emails to them NO REPLY..ZIP NADA ... now this thing pops a new leak in the vertical creases just below the top and right at the water line every other week....absolute GARBAGE liner.... Amazon and DM completely ignored my repeated complaints...back when I tried numerous times to 'register' this spa the Bestways website said NO SUCH serial number..COLEMAN FAILS MISERABLY on this junk spa.... owned 3mo...expect yours to fail as well HORRIBLE absolutely HORRIBLE DM follow up.... FFFFFFF------- -5 rating
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken in one month!!!! Not possible to return even if defective!!
customer_reviews.text: The Coleman Saluspa sounds great, but unfortunately it is poorly designed. In less than one month, the temperature sensor failed and the unit became useless. So, I’m not optimistic about its reliability. That said, Bestway’s warranty and service held up well. I filled out the online form for a warranty claim and someone called me within 48 hours to complete it. We were without the spa for a little over a week, which isn’t bad all things considered. If it remains working, I’ll update the review. My other main complaint is with Amazon’s product documentation. The return policy is not advertised and differs from seller’s standard policies. PLEASE BE AWARE THAT THIS PRODUCT IS NOT RETURNABLE EVEN IF DEFECTIVE!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Bodine

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I love love loved this hot tub! It worked exactly as it was suppose to for almost 2 months! Then it crapped out and I am now stuck being aggravated trying to fix it! It is a short term rental. We loved it and we laughed at the true value we had got! The last laugh is on us. Buy something better than this for the long run!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Marchetti

customer_reviews.title: We loved it, for a little while...
customer_reviews.text: My husband absolutely loved this spa. It is sturdy and relaxing. After a few months of use one of the rubber gaskets wore out. All the water leaked out. You can't get replacement parts! Coleman doesn't actually manufacture the pump, and cannot provide us with information about where to get the parts. We have ordered many parts hoping one would fit, but none do, so after 6 months of use it is useless. I do NOT recommend. It was fun for a little while.
customer_reviews.author: Amy A

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase!!!!!! We use it almost nightly. No regrets purchasing! I purchased for my husbands birthday and had it set up in about 45 minutes. The instructions are not the best but ultimately it was pretty easy. I’m in Florida so it holds the temp well... during the winter (not that we have much of one) it will drop about 4 degrees when the top comes off. But it can maintain 103 on a normal day. We have drained it and moved it about 4 times it’s a fast/easy process. It has been going strong for about 6 months now and we are still in love! I would purchase again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the price....
customer_reviews.text: ...this hot tub is fantastic! I bought it to replace a broken $4500 hot tub that would’ve cost me about $800 - $1000 to repair. It’s first use was for a huge party I held and it was used by adults and kids. Everyone of all ages loved it! The great thing is it’s easy to drain and move to a different location when it’s just myself. I can move it by myself or enjoy it with friends when they come to visit! Comfortable, and suits my needs perfectly. Couldn’t ask for anything more simple & durable. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lauralino

customer_reviews.title: Will last exactly one season, not more
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hot tub late in the season last year, worked great for about 6 weeks before I had to store it for the winter. Just brought it out of storage and set it up, but now it keeps deflating for no obvious reason. I've scoured the thing looking for holes in the liner but haven't been able to find any. The company refuses to honor the warranty because it's technically past the warranty date (since I stored it for the winter), even though I've only used it for a combined total of eight weeks. Extremely disappointing. Was worth the price when I bought it last year for $400, definitely NOT worth the recently jacked-up price of $800.
customer_reviews.author: KingCotton

customer_reviews.title: Great for winter or summer.
customer_reviews.text: This portable spa is a Godsend. I set it up on my outdoor screen patio. It's over 100* F outside all summer so I wanted a private pool to keep cool during summer and of course, turn the heat on at winter. I love it! It was simple to setup though the instructions were poorly designed at best but I figured it out. Sturdy construction, padded floor and the bubbles are amazing. I definitely recommend this spa.
customer_reviews.author: Warpcore

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this a week ago and love it! Easy to set up and everything works. It doesn't come with started kit for chemicals. He heats up to the 100's in about 18 hours. Very comfortable for 2 people, but 3 would be ok too. It's quite when heating. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: K-Dub

customer_reviews.title: broken
customer_reviews.text: So it was totally hard to set up, i needed to seek out a smart and strong man to help, especially twisting the jobs together tight enough not to leak. The timer threw me off because i guess it will just automatically turn off after a couple days which proved to be a bummer when i went to go in it and it was completely broken because it’s winter!!!
customer_reviews.author: Emily B

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this spa is great. At first I was skeptical. Didn’t think it would get hot enough and thought the materials would be to cheesy. Well I was pleasantly surprised to find that the materials are heavy duty and it keeps the heat very well. And 104 is plenty hot enough. I am very happy with this spa being the first one I’ve ever purchased. If it lasts me a couple year than I will have gotten my money’s worth and I’ll be ready to upgrade ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hot tub
customer_reviews.text: Great hot tub, the pump does shut off periodically for no reason and it seems like its always when I'm ready to go soak and the temp is down to 90. It flashes an error code but I haven't figured out the problem yet.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Only works for about a year
customer_reviews.text: We loved this product until it shopped working correctly. Every few days we hear an annoying "beep beep" and go outside to see an "E02" ERROR code flashing. We have to shut it down and then "whack" the side of the pump until to make it work again. Often is must be done a few times to get it going again. Wish there was a better fix to this because we do love this.
customer_reviews.author: SD Mar

customer_reviews.title: Better than you might think.
customer_reviews.text: This hot tub is much sturdier and nicer than I expected. The Good: Quick setup* Well made for the price Comfortable to sit in The Bad: Takes 24 hours to heat water to 104(f). Automatically shuts off after 3 days and must be manually restarted. The instructions and setup documentation are very poor. Chemical management is a bit tricky considering it's small volume. Filters are not that great and must be cleaned frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Shiflet

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE our hot tub!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this hot tub after speaking with a friend who had recently purchased one and raved about it. It was so easy to set up and we have enjoyed it ever since! So perfect for taking the chill off on cool winter evenings! We moved recently and just emptied it and folded it back in it's box so we could store it til we were in our next location. What a great buy and we would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a nice soaking tub!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Stone

customer_reviews.title: Relaxing
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived two days early which was HUGE! We had it set up in just a couple hours. We used it the following evening. 104 was so HOT, but yet so relaxing. I like that you can adjust the temperature as you like and the bubbles make for a nice spa experience. It fits perfectly on the patio and the size is just right for my husband and I. I wouldn’t try to fit 2 sets of couples in it, but it did fit myself, my husband, and my mom. I like that I am able to completely submerge as it comes up to my neck. Overall, I’d say this was a perfect relaxation investment!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!  Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: This is very cheaply made. We've had two Intex hottubs, and they were by far better quality materials for alot less money. Plus they were nearly twice the size. The only way four people will fit in this tub is if they're 10 year olds! The instructions are very vague. Pictures only. I really don't see this thing lasting a year!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: This spa has a 3-day auto shut-off feature that is stupid!
customer_reviews.text: I have been very frustrated with this hot tub because I have it on my houseboat that I visit on weekends. However, the heater has a 3 day auto-shutoff feature that means that if no buttons are pressed in 3 days it shuts off. So inconvenient if you don't go in the hot tub every day or every other day. I had an Intex and never had that problem. I may have to just sell this one at a discount and get an Intex. THEY SHOULD HAVE A BYPASS FOR THIS STUPID FEATURE.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: The Coleman Saluspa is so easy to setup!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of putting the spa together. I put it all together myself and I’m a 71 year old grandmother! I also loved the price rather than spending $5000 or more on a regular spa. This spa operates on a 110 electrical outlet, so that was a plus too. I put in the corner of my garage so I can use it all year! I love it. It’s relaxing and easy to maintain!
customer_reviews.author: Dali Mama

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, for a inflatable hot tub that only requires a 110 outlet and is under $400, it's definitely worth the price. Right now it's a heat wave summer so no problem keeping the water hot, fall will be the true test to see how well the heater can keep up. The only negative aspect I can think of is it says seats 2-4. It can seat 4 I suppose abiet tightly. The most important part of seating more than 2 is that the jets only blow 1/2-3/4 of the circumference so one person would not get full jets. I knew I would only need to seat 2 so no worries for me. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: It is very sturdy, and deep enough for adults. I think three people max would be okay, but four would probably be too many. The bubbles are quite boisterous, and once I get it up to temperature, it will be relaxing and as therapeutic I think as a hotel jaccuz. The only complaint I have is we are in southern California, and we had it heating for 6 hours to raise it 12°. I have no idea how long it will take to get it to temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Dara

customer_reviews.title: I can't say enough good things about this.
customer_reviews.text: My whole family loves it.. it's amazing, without the commitment of a permanent hot tub.. well worth the money. It is sturdy and heats up relatively quickly (I turn it to like 82-85 when not in use, then turn it up a few hours before I know someone will go in). My boys spend a lot of time in here, so we don't go much above 90ish to avoid giving them heat stroke but my husband and I have cranked it and we just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Loo

customer_reviews.title: Great value, easy to use, high quality!
customer_reviews.text: What a gem! Self inflating and assemble could not have been easier. Sturdy locking lid keeps leaves and rain out, heats up to 104. Would not want it any hotter. I’ve been researching these for a while, would buy it again and again. I love the fact that we can take it down and move it if we want to, been using it every night. We will take it indoors when it’s too cold to have it outside. Instructions are not super clear on the chemistry part but the local spa store was helpful in getting us set up. Get this tub, so relaxing and super affordable compared to the permanent models.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Tooth

customer_reviews.title: Need better instructions,disappointed initially, hoping for better outcome!
customer_reviews.text: It did not come with a ground cover, which was my misreading the insulated protector bit in the description. The paper instructions were severely lacking and online video's were for older models. My pump failed with in 15 minutes, quiet disappointing, but not surprising for the cost. But after registering my product and submitting my claim online, a new pump is on the way. I took a video of it running bad before attempting to restart it, at which time it would not. Should be back in operation in about a week. Not bad considering price. Will try to update after it is received.
customer_reviews.author: Andy W.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, great for first time hot tub owner. Very easy to set up. Hardly use the bubbles but the water gets nice and hot, even in cold weather. I keep mine set up all the time. Warning does use a lot of energy, I have definitely noticed a difference for my power bill. Also realize that this is not intended to be used in weather under 40 degrees F. For the price it has been worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great product some issues
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this item and I love it but it does come with some issues. 1. It doesn't seat 4 people, Haha it barely fits the 2 of us. 2. If you are under 5'4" you will not be able to sit down because it has no seats. The jets work great and filter system is awesome. I have yet to use the heat option, too hot for it. But I'm really thinking on buying a better version. Not sure this will last threw a hurricane.
customer_reviews.author: Luis R Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, sturdy and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great deal! The hot tub is sturdy and heats from the motor just like the Soft Tub we had at our beach house which we loved at 10 times the price. We’ll have to see how well it holds up to being deflated in the fall and opened again next spring. It is very comfortable with the pad included for underneath. It is perfectly sized for two adults but could probably fit 3 who are willing to just sit with their legs under them. Since I’m only 5’ tall I ordered a seat which allows me to sit shoulder deep in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Bendler

customer_reviews.title: Hot tub on a budget
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up and get going, I have broken bones in an amputation from an accident that wasn't my fault, so this has been heaven. The only thing I do not like, once it gets to 104 degrees, the heater shuts off til it gets to 100, then kicks back on. 72 hours run time, have to shut off turn back on within that time to keep from shutting down and finding a cool tub. I use this in my basement with a containment dam built around it. Over all, it helps me, and that I like.....
customer_reviews.author: Timm

customer_reviews.title: Hot tub replaces pool
customer_reviews.text: I had a 10ft inflatable top ring pool in my basement for many years I have now removed it and replaced it with this hot tub. The pool was much larger but it presented a lot of things to deal with that the new hot tub has built into the system. I liked it so well I ordered another one to give to my employee for a Christmas bonus. The first one took me an hour to assemble, but the second one won't take me 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: hamster

customer_reviews.title: Fun while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Keep getting an EO2 error signifying no water flow. Im guessing prolonged heat made the hoses soft and they kink under the weight of the tub. Tried using house clamps to open them up but no success.
customer_reviews.author: Dude Conn

customer_reviews.title: Great little spa
customer_reviews.text: Until I sat in my friend's tub, I never imagined how well and inflatable tub would work. The bubbles are strong and while not jets, they're effective and the tub is comfortable for 3-4 adults. A padded floor mat underneath makes a nicer base. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: E Vargas

customer_reviews.title: A little short on the heat...
customer_reviews.text: I'm concerned that the heat system is not big/efficient enough! 2 days out of 7 fir the past 2 weeks the temperature at 10 pm has been 100. The unit is set at 104. While 100 is warm, I feel the heat is not working properly. Out soa is actually black in color and is in direct sunlight from 11 am until 9pm this time of year. Did the manufacturer count too heavily on solar heating?
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and inexpensive replacement for my old hot tub
customer_reviews.text: Gave away my old hot tub, finished the deck, and bought this as a 3 season replacement, primarily to be used by my children. All of the other reviews are fairly accurate. You can't use it in the winter. It's easy to assemble. It runs constantly to maintain the 104F. It's soft, comfortable and easy to maintain (clean the filters, add chemicals).
customer_reviews.author: Jason Coulter

customer_reviews.title: Prefect solution!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect solution for those who rent! Padded bottem is surprisingly comfortable. Bubbles are actually a lot stronger than i anticipated. My only complaint, which it really isnt, you have to run the pump 24/7 for it to maintain heat all the time. When you turn the pump off, the heat goes off and the pool loses heat. I assume as the months get cooler this will be more of an issue to get it back up to temperature. Now it will drop to about 87 and takes 3 hours to get up to 100. Overall, I love it!! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dawnett

customer_reviews.title: you will get vague unclear responses if you try and return this.
customer_reviews.text: Good luck getting anyone to help you actually return the item if you decide the item isn't for you. I asked repeatedly to return item and give me shipping information to return. It was always a vague response leaving me clueless as to what to do. So I spent all this money on an item that is still in the box and not wanted and looks like it isn't returnable. In addition to the owner being vague, Amazon assured they would email me a return label but did not. Needless to say, I am not happy with the whole ordeal.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Really Like This Spa
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my Intex that broke after 3 years. I especially like how lightweight the motor is and how easy it is to carry. If it could have one thing to complete it, that would be a light solar blanket to throw over the water while no one is in instead of having to put the entire cover over it. Other then that, I'm really happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this thing!!!! You have to remember it isn’t an expensive permanent hot tub. With that being said my wife I used it every night until it started getting to cold out to keep it up. Once you are in it the temperature will start to go down (depending on outside air temperature) since the air jets and drawing cooler air and blowing it threw the water. This is a purchase that I have zero regrets about and would buy again!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. northup

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after only 2.5 months
customer_reviews.text: We have had this hot tub less than 3 months and it started leaking after we took it apart to clean it. I had to drain the new water and found that the rubber washer tore inside the tube. I have no idea how it will be replaced because the washer is attached inside. I also got on amazon looking for replacements and couldn’t find one. We are so upset.
customer_reviews.author: Magan

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product before labor day weekend. It was supposed to arrive on Sunday and it arrived on Saturday. A day early. I was extremely happy and excited about the early delivery. It was easy to assemble and set up. The jets (bubbles) are pretty strong and it heats up decently. I am extremely pleased with the purchase and I would strongly recommend it. I've received many compliments from others that have seen the tub. I added the water resistant lights and looks very nice and fancy.
customer_reviews.author: Franky Chavez

customer_reviews.title: CORRECTION TO PREVIOUS 1 STAR SUBMISSION
customer_reviews.text: This product was previously given a 1 star because I got the product number mixed up with an order that I previously received from a different vendor which was not to my expectation. I would like to correct the previous 1 star submission because everything associated with this product was awesome. I would definitely recommend this product and vendor to anyone that would want to make this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Well, we got what we paid for. The instructions were terrible but we eventually got it assembled and working. The problem is that after 3 weeks it stopped working. There are no returns evidently so we are going to try to work through the manufacturer. Do not get this!!!
customer_reviews.author: William D Jamison

customer_reviews.title: so far so good, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a week, so far so good, comfortable. Wanted to give 4 1/2 but not available, the timer is a little confusing (just me) no time display but instead starts 1 to 24 hours after touching the setting but can't tell for sure. Make it easy on yourself and fill from hot water tank or tap, it will take a very long time to heat up. Very simple one person set up. I put my on snap together work out mat for added comfort and to protect the bottom of spa.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Pump didn’t hold up
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed after the first use! We thoroughly enjoyed this hot tub for about 6 months, until the pump quit working. No hot water, and no bubbles. The pumps are NOT sold separately. SOL is the short and sweet version of what VM Express told me. So just beware! Be prepared to shell out the full price if the pump quits! It’s a great product overall though. Just wish the pump was a bit more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Von Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was nice at first when it was still really warm out but once it got to the 70's at night the spa's temp would drop at least 15 degrees after we took the top off and got in. When you turn on the bubbles the water would get even colder. After 2 months the machine wouldn't go any higher then 95 degrees all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Hollie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing hot tub!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough good things about this hot tub! It was so easy to set up, the pump actually inflates it! The jets are really impressive for an inflatable tub. The bottom is soft enough to sit on. The temperature controls and timer are easy to use and heats up to a toasty 104 degrees. The top is easy to put on and take off. We love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: AMANDA LOTTS

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 8 months
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed it while it lasted. Broke within 8 months and then I never heard back per our warranty claim.
customer_reviews.author: Freedom Vans

customer_reviews.title: Small but nice
customer_reviews.text: Definitely cannot fit 4 adults in this. 2 adults, 3 if theyre small. Im 5’10” shes 5’6” im 220 shes way less. We can sit in it comfortably together but theres no room for anyone else. Takes forever to heat up, id say 1 degree an hour which is normal for a tub but most tubs are 8-900 gallons this ones 300 so i thought it would be a little quicker. Also loses heat fast when you turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: LEGIT!
customer_reviews.text: If you live in a cold area. And you use the bubbles then it may not stay at the temp you are trying to use. It goes down a few degrees every 30-60 min. But I don’t use the bubbles and it doesn’t go down at all. So just depends on your bubble usages if you have kids and they are in and out all the time, that to might make the water go down in temp. But over all Thjs was an awesome 800$ Used!!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Leaks air, will not stay inflated
customer_reviews.text: From the beginning it will not hold air. Requested warranty help but was denied because they said the serial number was incorrect. Double checked and serial number stamped on the spa was the one I turned in. Need to re-inflate before each use. If not re-inflated by the 3rd day it gets so soft water starts running over the edge. Tried to find leak by using soapy water to no avail. Even drained it and re-inflated and turned upside down and still could not detect a leak. Still using it but a real pain having to air it up before every use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer melba

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Expect Much, VERY SUPRISED
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have high expectations for this blow-up 'hot tub'. BUT WOW, it is better than I expected. It is a nice alternative for those of us who move a lot. It took a day to get up to temp, but then has held it very well. The bubbles are far more vigorous than I ever expected. You get a nice message even though there are no jets. I am pretty happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Krista Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how well this works. The 1600 watt heater is weak but the best you can do on a 120 volt 20 amp circuit. The timer function is kinda dumb and I never used it. The bubbles are ok but they cut the heat off due to the amp limits. For the money, I’m glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hales

customer_reviews.title: great "real" hot tub alternative
customer_reviews.text: this is not a real hot tub with powerful massaging jets but it does have bubbles that sooth you, for a short person it is difficult to sit on the bottom without floating. it serves a purpose but if you are expecting a real hot tub experience this is not that.
customer_reviews.author: Anne V. Bialeski

customer_reviews.title: Bad, terrible, worthless instructions!  Tub works in spite of them.
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 3 and 1/2 stars just for the fact the set up instructions were atrocious! It took an hour for my boyfriend and I to figure it out. We still have parts and pieces that we don’t know what they are for. I watched the videos and none of them had the same hook ups my tub has. Now that it is working, we really like it. It heats up to 104 degrees but when using the bubbles, it does cool down to 98 to 99 within 30 min. We will use it until we can install something more permanent.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Wood

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Spa is very nice. Pretty durable. Looks and works great. It would help if instruction pictures had a little more word explanation. Happy with it. Better to leave water heated to desired temperature and keep it that way instead of trying to reheat when you want to use it. It takes about 24 hrs to heat so keep it at desired temp. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Creative Angel

customer_reviews.title: Two adult capacity
customer_reviews.text: Tub appears to be of good quality. Functions as it should. Certainly not room for more than 2 adults of average size will fit w/o some sorta magic shrinking device, but that was expected. Instructions were pretty much useless, but fairly simple to figure out, and plenty of coverage on you tube. Shipping and customer service was outstanding
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, affordable, great heat, a good alternative to very expensive spas. I have a pain disorder and 20 minutes in this every day really helps.
customer_reviews.author: therainbowbakerytexas

customer_reviews.title: So very nice after work, before bed.
customer_reviews.text: We didn't expect much, under 400 bucks, if it worked for a couple of weeks, I would've been glad. It was a birthday present for my wife. We are so wrong, we LOVE it. Our spa is used daily, we bought it in March 2019. It was easy to assemble, fills quickly, so nice. The circulation timer and the heater timer are a bit to get the hang of. You can not use an extension cord with it. However, All in all, its wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Shertenlieb

customer_reviews.title: Suggestion: seller needs remove adult signature requirement
customer_reviews.text: Product came great and quicker than expected came within 4-5 days. One thing I will make note on is for the seller of the product to remove “adult signature” not really sure how it works if they could just do a signature in general or something but I’m 20 years old and own my own house and I basically got into a fight with UPS to give me my package because I’m not “21” and not old enough to sign for my own hot tub that I purchased. UPS informed me that it was a requirement on the senders behalf. Other than this good product and i would definitely recommend this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Siera Triona

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I've made!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my hot tub! I have a lot of back issues and this has really helped me. It's super easy to install and use. I'm so glad that I found a quality hot tub for a great price! You can't go wrong buying this hot tub.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Not having great luck ....
customer_reviews.text: Initial few weeks were fine other than it takes a significant amount of time to heat. Spa was easy to set up and use. Tub began leaking after a few months and was promptly replaced under warranty. After setting up the new tub within a week water was leaking from bottom of filter and was making noise. Claim has been filed for this issue and hopefully will be resolved. Without these issues spa was comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ID Guy

customer_reviews.title: so good! The directions are a little vague in some ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had mine a few weeks, but so far, so good! The directions are a little vague in some places, but it honestly wasn't that hard to figure out. 2 day shipping for Prime members was a definite added bonus! This is a perfect spa for someone who doesn't want to invest a lot of money into a permanent spa, but wants something to help relax and unwind at night.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: great Product !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: fits perfect inside in my sun room I love it ceiling fan and screen door provides adequate ventilation very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.author: Bobby S

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for 1-2 people! We love it! Basically ordered it as a transition tub as we will be moving and didn’t want to move a large tub. You do have to restart every 72 hours which can be annoying. I wish it had a feature to just stay on select temp
customer_reviews.author: Jaden J.

customer_reviews.title: takes a while to heat but great to relax in for the money overall
customer_reviews.text: the controls could be a bit smarter. filter is undersized as well. takes a while to heat but great to relax in for the money overall.
customer_reviews.author: steve johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not inflatable.
customer_reviews.text: I put it up and it would never hold air when I inflated it. I tried to return it but it said it was not returnable totally disappointed 😕😕😕😕😕
customer_reviews.author: Diane Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!!! Easy to set up and didn't take long to fill. I've only had it a couple weeks and I spend a lot of time in it. The other reviews note that it takes awhile to heat up, very true. I have adjusted it several times because of the summer heat I don't want it as hot , so I haven't got it to the perfect temp., but I'm sure as it gets cooler I'll be able to set it up and keep it at that temp. Very well made!!! It's awesome to come home to after 10 hours of physical work!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, even better price
customer_reviews.text: If you don't want to spend big bucks on a stand alone Jacuzzi then this is one to get. My wife and I love it. As long as you're willing to put in time to do maintenance and cleaning, this thing will last. I'll admit tough, emptying it, cleaning, and refilling it back up is a chore, but you'll be glad to know you can jump inside and relax right after~
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We thought we would try this for fun to see if we liked t and wanted to deal with pool treatments etc. We love this thing. Put it together in less then 2 minutes,!heated it over night and hot tubed looking at the Mighty Mo over coffee. Still learning the chlorine stuff but easy enough to drain and start from the beginning!
customer_reviews.author: cttngchick

customer_reviews.title: Really Great...Once.
customer_reviews.text: This hot tub worked great and was so much fun the first time we set it. We had it up for about a week and a half and then put it away. When the weather started to warm up this year we busted it out again and it's full of holes. We tried to patch them, but it's hopeless. We just keep finding more holes and it won't stay inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put up and works great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put up and works great. We previously had another brand so we were aware that we would have to make sure the pump was still running every few days and it was not a big deal to us. For the price, this is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: BrandyC

customer_reviews.title: No. Just don’t. It’s tiny and poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: This was great at first but after two months it started losing air. Got a pin hole that we found and then turned into a huge gaping hole. Hunk of junk. Don’t buy this. Oh and by the way it turns off every 3 days and you have to manually go out and make sure it’s on. Do your research and splurge a bit for the better inflatable hot tub.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best value on Amazon for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best value on Amazon for the money! Quick and easy to set up works fantastic very comfortable to sit in and easy to maintain
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a short run.
customer_reviews.text: It’s great for the first 6-7 months. Can’t expect a lot for the price. Works well if you stay on top of the filters (2) and chemical. I would not recommend in weather below 40-50deg. Works great indoors/covered area.
customer_reviews.author: 5H Palo Cedro CA

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: We love our spa. Right now we aren’t using the heat, (Florida) but it’s perfect to relax in at the end of the day. Is it as nice as a $5/7k spa? Nope, but then I didn’t pay anywhere close to that. Looking forward to our 10 days of cool temps to check out the heater.
customer_reviews.author: Camper Girl

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Hot! Bought it as a gift for my parents because we ran out of ideas for gifts! They loved it. Easy set up and we took the recommendation of hooking it up to the kitchen sink, worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Sed

customer_reviews.title: Amazon gets 5 stars but this product is a flop :(
customer_reviews.text: Amazon customer service gets 5 stars for thier customer retention but the product legitimately doesn't work. It deflated after two days and never reached more than 100 degrees after being on for a full 24 hours. For reference this was in 95 degree weather so the ambient temperature alone should have brought it up. I guess there's really no such thing as a cheap hottub, which is unfortunate, because I really wanted this to be a good product 🤷‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: Jon Otto

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: It arrived damaged, and after some time spent with customer service who quite frankly didn't know what they were doing a new unit arrived two weeks later. I had a portable hot tub a few years ago and I have to say I'm amazed at the advancement. I've used this at least 20 times and it's set up outside of my patio. At no point has the temperature dropped when I've been inside and it also seems to funnel in hot water even when the Jets are on. I would thoroughly recommend this unit. PS It's more of a two-person hot tub than a four
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I’ve ever made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older model we had for 2 1/2 years before the pump died. In the spring, summer and fall, my husband and I use this hot tub every night. It’s absolutely wonderful and you can’t beat it for the price. I tell everyone I know to buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Rafferty

customer_reviews.title: Received hot tub with hole, terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: We received a hot tub with a hole in the liner. After assembling it the air was out of the hot tub within 24 hours. We reassembled multiple times trying to figure out what was going wrong and realized that it was faulty. We contacted this amazon company, who sent us to coleman, who sent us to bestway corp, and everyone has blown us off. I have filled out 3 warranty claims with pictures and proof of purchase and emailed several times with no help. Now close to $400 later we are stuck with a hot tub that won't hold air.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Took out box today 26 june 2020 both boxes had No instructions no dvd looked at box and online. Now got set up error 02 comes on every time hit heat or filter button.
customer_reviews.author: a real person

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is unusual for me as I rarely submit reviews. However, I hope that by doing this someone will save their money and time. Set up the unit per instructions. Made certain all connections were correct and the drain caps removed. Four days after receipt, the heating element / water pump stopped working. Getting through to the company and filing a warranty claim seems impossible. Spend your $700+ dollars on something else.
customer_reviews.author: John Trent

customer_reviews.title: Second defective coleman in one season.
customer_reviews.text: So this happens, I bought 2 now with the same issue.. this happened after 1 month in the Californian sun. Costumer service is very complicated. Dont trust all the positive reviews, and make sure you complain within the warranty, parts take ages to arrive. Still waiting on an answer on my defective second coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: High Performance for a Decent Price
customer_reviews.text: If you are on the fence with buying one of these because “it’s an inflatable hot tub” don’t be!! I’ve been in many hot tubs and for only 400 bucks this one performs almost just as well as the real thing. The only downfalls are that it takes a bit to heat up and it cools down a in 25-30 minutes. But I honestly can stay in for that long anyway. I highly suggest these little things. Tons of performance for you dollar!!
customer_reviews.author: Jorin Hollenbeak

customer_reviews.title: A life saver for me
customer_reviews.text: It was much more than expected. The bubbles are strong and temp is great. May at times take awhile to heat up if you don't use for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Rauch

customer_reviews.title: Mother of a wounded warrior wasted her money, and is on a fixed income.
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled Registered Nurse who served my community for 30 years. I enjoyed the spa when it worked, but since I've tried to reinflate it things have gone wrong. It won't hold air. I've had multiple neighbors who tried to help me fix it. I having my third back surgery this year and really need it. I have a wounded warrior who needs it himself. We don't have $700 dollars to throw away on something that doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice cheaper hot tub option
customer_reviews.text: First, the instructions aren't very clear but still wasn't hard to set up. Build quality seems great so far. It is warmer here outside right now so water heated up quickly to 104°. When turning on the bubbles the temperature did drop but only by 2°. I imagine when it's colder outside it will probably have a little trouble staying at that temperature. Works great (and I love it), but the only drawback is the bubbles. They are super vigorous and there's no way to turn them down. Glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Goomah "Nick"

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price but small!
customer_reviews.text: Only really good for one person or a couple. Very soft bottom good pressure. Jets work pretty good for a blow up. It shorts out a lot though and my electric and boxes are all new from addition and up to date and can handle the wattage so not sure why. Other than that it’s been pretty good
customer_reviews.author: cynthia

product_meta.title: Coleman SaluSpa Portable 4 Person Outdoor Inflatable Hot Tub Spa with 60 AirJets and Pump, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe Coleman Inflatable Miami Spa is an inflatable hot tub that seats 4 people and is completely portable so you can take it with you on your vacations or relax at home. It has massage jets and a cushioned floor, making it easy for you to unwind. The hot tub inflates within minutes and the rapid heating system quickly heats the water up to a soothing 104 degrees with 60 surrounding air jets. The hot temperature is perfect for soothing sore muscles or lounging after a long day and the digital control panel lets you adjust the temperature without having to get out of the tub. The walls are made of durable 3-ply PVC and have sturdy I-Beam construction that allows you to sit on the sides of the spa thanks to the superior structural stability. There are 2 handles built into the sides for easy transportation. This package also includes a chemical floater to keep your spa clean, a twin pack of filter cartridges, and an inflatable cover to keep your water warm when you're not using it. Enjoy the luxury of a hot tub in your house by yourself, with friends, or as a romantic treat with the Coleman Inflatable Miami Spa. Not to be used in temperatures under 40 degrees.
feature_bullets: INFLATABLE HOT TUB: The Coleman SaluSpa inflatable hot tub is made for up to 4 people and heats up quickly to a soothing 104 degrees with 60 surrounding air jets

FEATURES: Relax at the touch of a button with the soothing AirJet Spa, rapid heating system, and integrated water filtration; Cushioned floor with convenient drain valve; Heating and bubbling work together to provide a comfortable massage experience

DURABLE CONSTRUCTION: TriTech 3 ply inflated walls for durability and comfort; Reinforced cover with safety lock clips and built-in air chamber for insulation; 2 easy-lift handles to help move the spa pool (when empty)

PRODUCT INFO: Includes 1 pool liner, 1 pool cover, 1 spa pump, 1 chemical floater, 2 filter cartridges (VI), 1 air pad protector, 1 repair patch, 1 AirJet system. Water capacity (80% filled): 192 gallons, heat range: 40-104 degrees F, water flow: 320 GPH

PRODUCT INFO: The dimensions of the inflatable hot tub are (L x W x H): 71 x 71 x 26 inches with Manufacturer warranty (pump): 1-year warranty; Manufacturer warranty (liner): 90-day warranty. Heat range is 40-140 degrees Fahrenheit

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars720 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
